response1.improvementExplanation: The repartition() operation is used to increase the number of partitions in the DataFrame. However, in this case, we only need to write the data to a single file, so we can use coalesce() instead. Coalesce() will reduce the number of partitions to the specified number, which will improve performance by reducing the amount of data that needs to be shuffled.
response1.benefits: Reduced shuffling, improved resource usage, and faster job runtime.
